alert.note: Alert for Eastern Rutland; Eastern Windsor; Western Windsor (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 18 at 5:02PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Rutland and southwestern Windsor Counties through 600 PM EDT... At 501 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Andover, moving north at 10 mph. HAZARD...Torrential rainfall and winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Chester, Woodstock, Mount Holly, Ludlow, Cavendish, Andover, Weston, Ludlow Village, Mt. Holly, Plymouth, Reading, West Windsor, Baltimore, Shrewsbury, Bridgewater, Mount Tabor, Killington, Hartland, Weathersfield, and Mendon. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Rutland; Eastern Windsor; Western Windsor
